intro: Thalictrum minus subsp. jacquinianum, commonly known as the lesser meadow rue, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a fibrous root system and produces showy, spicate inflorescences that attract pollinators like bees and flies. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for ecological restoration and native garden landscapes.
